Articles.Content: **Felipe (HarvesteR)** > > *Felipe was unavailable at this time.* > **Mike (Mu)** > > Another fun filled week of the UI and Unity 5 upgrade. I have written a new tooltip system which is a lot simpler than our previous one. Have also liberally been putting tooltips on everything. This ties into something new which is coming as part of the UI upgrade, localisation! We have written a localisation system for deploying the game into different languages, this is being implemented alongside the UI upgrade and allows a wide variety of character sets and fonts. MÃÂµÃÂ½Ã‘Â Ã‘â‚¬ÃÂ°ÃÂ·ÃÂ´Ã‘Æ’ÃÂ²ÃÂ°ÃÂµÃ‘â€š ÃÂ¾Ã‘â€š Ã‘â‚¬ÃÂ°ÃÂ´ÃÂ¾Ã‘ÂÃ‘â€šÃÂ¸!! **Marco (Samssonart)** > > Last week I went back to the Launcher, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m worked on something we can give a massive announcement with, itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s already done and you will see the aforementioned announcement. **Daniel (danRosas)** > > *Dan is currently Stateside.* **Jim (Romfarer)** > > Work continues on the upgraded editor and application launcher. As for the editor we are changing the way parts are displayed, slightly. Instead of the old tabs where you get a fixed amount of parts on each page and have to flip back and forth, we are a adding a scrollable parts list. **Max (Maxmaps)** > > Hunt for a CM finally done! Was a long process but finally have someone who will help further tighten the relations between devs and players. Besides that, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been working on the business side of things to do incredibly fun things like standardizing our invoices and databases. Not everything we do is super fun to write about, sadly. **Ted (Ted)** > > The past several days have been pretty busy here! IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been going over the Experimental Applications IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve received so far, and a lot of applications are looking very promising. If you have yet to apply, feel free to do so here, all are welcome! - [http://goo.gl/forms/FSzjQIM2pY]([http://goo.gl/forms/FSzjQIM2pY](https://goo.gl/forms/FSzjQIM2pY) > > Apart from that, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been doing the usual production tasks, one of which has been following your feedback about the Relays and Antenna improvements. The level of detail and constructiveness has been great and RoverDude and I have been discussing the feedback and heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s been incorporating it into his designs and developing some prototypes to explore the ideas. > > Finally, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been working with Max to finish working out our new server specifications with Multiplay so that all our online services are on more stable and managed servers. **Kasper (KasperVld)** > > ThereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s really not a lot to talk about on my end today, itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s been a lot of administrative busywork and number crunching. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been working through the backlog created by my week off. One of the things IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m tackling at the moment is the pre-release access for YouTubers and Twitch streamers. If you run a YouTube or Twitch channel with a decently large following (YouTube Ã¢â€°Â¥10.000 followers, Twitch Ã¢â€°Â¥2.500 followers) and you play KSP regularly, please send me a message if youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re interested in obtaining pre-release access to new versions. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll soon open an application process for smaller channels as well. > > IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m very excited to learn that weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve found a new community manager, that should allow us to make even more time to communicate with you guys and allow me to get some sleep again!

Sweet! I actually forgot it was Tuesday!

> 
> Have also liberally been putting tooltips on everything.

Much needed!

> 
> IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m worked on something we can give a massive announcement with, itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s already done and you will see the aforementioned announcement.

Tease ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> As for the editor we are changing the way parts are displayed, slightly. Instead of the old tabs where you get a fixed amount of parts on each page and have to flip back and forth, we are a adding a scrollable parts list.

Sounds cool. QuickScroll is one of my must-install mods. While you're tinkering, if you happened to implement multiple (and negative) filters I'd be pretty happy. Right now, you can't find LF only tanks. You can find all tanks that have LF in them, but can't filter out the ones that also have O in them.

> 
> IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been doing the usual production tasks, one of which has been following your feedback about the Relays and Antenna improvements. The level of detail and constructiveness has been great and RoverDude and I have been discussing the feedback and heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s been incorporating it into his designs and developing some prototypes to explore the ideas.

And I'm now more excited to try it.

> 
> One of the things IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m tackling at the moment is the pre-release access for YouTubers and Twitch streamers. If you run a YouTube or Twitch channel with a decently large following (YouTube Ã¢â€°Â¥10.000 followers, Twitch Ã¢â€°Â¥2.500 followers) and you play KSP regularly, please send me a message if youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re interested in obtaining pre-release access to new versions. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll soon open an application process for smaller channels as well.

I guess I'm in the "smaller channels as well" category. :/

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-28T22:20:28Z" title="07/28/2015 10:20  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 28, 2015</time> by Tw1**
Romfarer, please consider having the parts list scroll with the mousewheel on mouseover (i.e. no click required).

> 
> **Jim (Romfarer)**
> 
> 
> Work continues on the upgraded editor and application launcher. As for the editor we are changing the way parts are displayed, slightly. Instead of the old tabs where you get a fixed amount of parts on each page and have to flip back and forth, we are a adding a scrollable parts list.

Interestingly, when ObiVanDamme did the new version of OSE workshop, some people (including me) kept running into problems with freezing and crashes, mainly having to do with heavily modded games with lots of parts, so, um, just letting you know to watch out for that.

Of course though, it could be an Unity 4 issue, or maybe something with that mod.

> 
> **Max (Maxmaps)**
> 
> 
> Hunt for a CM finally done! Was a long process but finally have someone who will help further tighten the relations between devs and players.

I thought Kasper was okay for a Community Manager.

As for the guessing who it is, one of the major modders around here?

> You meant 10**,**000 right? (why do some places use "." and some ",' its confusing)

Both are used as decimal separators, in some countries you use one and the other in some other countries, and either can also be a thousand separator. Obviously you wouldn't use comma as a thousand separator if you're already using it as a decimal point ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Because I'm getting really confused, or maybe just getting old, would it be possible to add the employee's title next to their name in future DevNotes?

Example:
